metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9816 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A possible vulnerability exists where type confusion can occur when manipulating JavaScript objects in object groups, allowing for the bypassing of security checks within these groups. *Note: this vulnerability has only been demonstrated with UnboxedObjects, which are disabled by default on all supported releases.*. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 60.7, Firefox < 67, and Firefox ESR < 60.7.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9816` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '67.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3').
